sgraph

Interface IScenegraphRenderer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL3ScenegraphRenderer

    public interface IScenegraphRenderer
    This interface provides a general interface for the scene graph to use. Each scene graph is paired with a renderer. Specific implementations of this renderer will encapsulate rendering-specific code (e.g. OpenGL), but this interface itself is independent of specific rendering libraries. This helps in keeping the scene graph independent of specific rendering technologies.
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

    • Method Detail

      • setContext

        void setContext(java.lang.Object obj)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set a rendering context. Renderers often need a rendering context (e.g. the windowing context, etc.). The parameter is kept very general to support any library. Specific implementations must check if the type matches what they expect.
        Parameters:
        obj - the rendering context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the type of the rendering context is not as expected.

      • initShaderProgram

        void initShaderProgram(ShaderProgram shaderProgram)
        Initialize the renderer with the shader program. This will also read all relevant shader variables that it must set
        Parameters:
        shaderProgram -

      • getShaderLocation

        int getShaderLocation(java.lang.String name)
        Get the location of a particular shader variable. Renderers for individual meshes will need this to provide mesh-specific properties like material to the shaders. The intention is that the renderer stores only what is required to render it, not necessarily the entire mesh itself.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        an integer handle for the appropriate variable if it exists, -1 otherwise

      • addMesh

        void addMesh(java.lang.String name,
           PolygonMesh mesh)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a mesh to be rendered in the future.
        Parameters:
        name - the name by which this mesh is referred to by the scene graph
        mesh - the PolygonMesh object that represents this mesh
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - general mechanism to let the scene graph know of any problems

      • draw

        void draw(INode root,
        java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
        Draw the scene graph rooted at supplied node using the supplied modelview stack. This is usually called by the scene graph
        Parameters:
        root -
        modelView -

      • drawMesh

        void drawMesh(java.lang.String name,
            Material material,
            org.joml.Matrix4f transformation)
        Draw a specific mesh. This is called from a leaf node of the associated scene graph
        Parameters:
        name -
        material -
        transformation -
